akas: Liv and Maddie: Cali Style USA (fourth season title)
akas from release info: Liv and Maddie: Cali Style USA (fourth season title)

1.title: Sorta-Sisters-A-Rooney
1.plot: Liv, Maddie and the rest of the Rooney clan start their new life in California; Ruby comes home from summer camp and gets excited to have sort-of siblings but ends up in the middle of a sister fight between Liv and Maddie.

2.title: Linda and Heather-A-Rooney
2.plot: Liv thinks she landed a small role on a hit show called ''Linda and Heather'' but her part turns out to be much bigger; Joey experiences relationship woes.

3.title: Scare-A-Rooney
3.plot: Liv takes Ruby to a spooky dinner and runs into an old acquaintance, and Maddie comes face to face with the real-life ''spider-sprayer''; Parker and Joey must convince their classmates to celebrate Halloween.

4.title: Sing It Louder!!-A-Rooney
4.plot: Liv and Ruby get a part on Sing It Louder, It goes horribly wrong. Ruby cannot handle the pressure.

5.title: Slumber Party-A-Rooney
5.plot: Liv has a sleepover to help Ruby and her co-star Priya become better friends; Joey meets a new nemesis and Parker reveals a big surprise to Maddie.

6.title: Cali Christmas-A-Rooney
6.plot: When Maddie starts to miss Christmas in Wisconsin, Liv tries to cheer her up.

7.title: Stand-Up-A-Rooney
7.plot: Joey is nervous when he's invited to perform stand-up comedy at a local restaurant. Parker finds himself in a predicament.

8.title: Roll Model-A-Rooney
8.plot: Liv and her fellow female co-stars of "Sing It Louder!!" attempt to break a stereotype by organizing a woodblock derby race against the boys. Meanwhile, Maddie and Willow take part in a challenge at their local restaurant.

9.title: Falcon-A-Rooney
9.plot: Joey's popularity at school is threatened when an old nemesis from Wisconsin returns and Maddie feels the need to keep a close eye on Parker's new friend.

10.title: Ex-A-Rooney
10.plot: When Maddie and Josh start hanging out again, Joey feels awkward by their rekindled friendship. Meanwhile, Parker and Val find themselves in a jam when competing for a coveted finalist spot in the Mars Madness competition.

11.title: Tiny House-A-Rooney
11.plot: Maddie and Willow help a homeless acquaintance; Karen gets discovered by a modeling agent; Joey and Parker attempt to sneak into a movie.

12.title: Big Break-A-Rooney
12.plot: Joey's idol invites him to perform stand-up at the hottest comedy club; Liv and Maddie help Parker with his science experiment.

13.title: Sing It Live-A-Rooney
13.plot: Liv gets vocal nodes and has to avoid singing until she gets surgery. Unfortunately she has to sing for a live event "Sing it Live". Parker and Joey however, come up with a disturbing invention.

14.title: Voice-A-Rooney
14.plot: After Liv undergoes vocal surgery, she is unsure if she'll be able to sing again, so Karen and Maddie call in reinforcements to help; Parker and Val are surprised by their competition in the Mars Madness finals.

15.title: End-A-Rooney
15.plot: After exciting opportunities arise for each of the Rooney children, their summer plans are thrown into jeopardy.

1.title: Twin-A-Rooney
1.plot: Liv returns home after starring in a hit television show.

2.title: Team-A-Rooney
2.plot: Maddie is named captain of the girls' basketball team.

3.title: Sleep-A-Rooney
3.plot: Liv volunteers to supervise Parker's sleepover.

4.title: Steal-A-Rooney
4.plot: Maddie tries to set Liv up with a new friend, Ocean.

5.title: Kang-A-Rooney
5.plot: Maddie persuades Joey to talk to a girl in a Kangaroo costume.

6.title: Skate-A-Rooney
6.plot: Liv's skateboard pro boyfriend is coming to Wisconsin for a competition.

7.title: Dodge-A-Rooney
7.plot: Liv decides to volunteer at the senior center with Maddie.

8.title: Brain-A-Rooney
8.plot: Liv wants to be on Joey's Brain Olympics team, but Joey doesn't think she is smart enough.

9.title: Sweet 16-A-Rooney
9.plot: Karen throws Maddie a curve ball about the day she was born, and she and Liv realize planning their sweet 16 party together may be more complicated than expected.

10.title: Fa-la-la-A-Rooney
10.plot: Liv is asked to sing a duet at the town's holiday spectacular; Pete and Maddie are asked to decorate the town Christmas tree.

11.title: Switch-A-Rooney
11.plot: When Liv is up for a big sci-fi movie role and Maddie has to take her driver's test, the girls switch places for the day to help each other out.

12.title: Dump-A-Rooney
12.plot: Maddie and her dad Pete sign up for a basketball tournament.

13.title: Move-A-Rooney
13.plot: The Rooney kids mistakenly believe they are moving.

14.title: Slump-A-Rooney
14.plot: Willow's feelings for Joey keep her from doing her best at softball.

15.title: Moms-A-Rooney
15.plot: Liv gets jealous when Maddie and Karen take part in a mother-daughter weekend of pioneer living.

16.title: Shoe-A-Rooney
16.plot: Liv lets Maddie borrow a pair of new shoes in the hope of helping her bring out her feminine side, and it works well - too well.

17.title: Howl-A-Rooney
17.plot: The desired role of Tristan in "Space Werewolves" has been narrowed down to Liv and two other actors.

18.title: Flashback-A-Rooney
18.plot: Maddie is anxiously awaiting the arrival of a letter from the Junior Olympics that will tell her if she's been invited to try out for the basketball team. When the letter comes, Liv is worried about Maddie leaving because it was the same way when Liv left for Hollywood and they end up going into a flashback on the day Liv left for Hollywood.

19.title: BFF-A-Rooney
19.plot: Liv's friend South comes to visit and flirts with Diggie, and Maddie gets jealous.

20.title: Song-A-Rooney
20.plot: Due to an error in judgement, Liv's new single becomes a hit for the wrong reasons.

21.title: Space Werewolf-A-Rooney
21.plot: Liv feels that she has something to prove; she insists on doing her own stunts.

1.title: Premiere-A-Rooney
1.plot: The family is getting ready to compete against one another in the Wisconsin Cheddar-Brat Fest. Ironically, Liv's premiere of "Space Werewolves" is on the same night.

2.title: Pottery-A-Rooney
2.plot: Maddie is recovering from her knee injury and decides to take up a new hobby. Meanwhile, Karen asks Liv for advice on dressing cool, which results in a mother-and-daughter fashion face-off.

3.title: Helgaween-A-Rooney
3.plot: It's Halloween and Maddie accidentally triggers a spell creating Helga, Liv and Maddie's triplet, who is a complete nightmare.

4.title: Kathy Kan-A-Rooney
4.plot: Liv becomes quick friends with Korean popstar and international teen sensation Kathy Kan when she comes to the states to study the actress for the Korean version of her hit show, "Sing It Loud."

5.title: Match-A-Rooney
5.plot: Liv tries to play matchmaker and help Willow win over Joey's heart at the school dance.

6.title: Hoops-A-Rooney
6.plot: When Liv is offered the lead in a basketball movie, Maddie and Willow volunteer to transform her from a clumsy athlete to a basketball pro.

7.title: New Year's Eve-A-Rooney
7.plot: Liv co-hosts and performs at a New Year's Eve party, and when a secret is revealed on live TV, it causes Maddie to question her long-distance relationship with Diggie.

8.title: Bro-Cave-A-Rooney
8.plot: Joey and Parker have finally reached the point of no escape and have to clean their inexplicable filthy room. When they try to trick Liv and Maddie into cleaning it for them, the girls fight back with an even better ruse.

9.title: Upcycle-A-Rooney
9.plot: Maddie is devastated when she loses her twin charm bracelet that Liv had given her but when Liv makes her feel guilty, Maddie decides to teach her a lesson. Meanwhile, Joey's feelings are hurt when Parker gets a new cool older brother.

10.title: Rate-A-Rooney
10.plot: Liv, Maddie and their friends confront a fellow schoolmate who has been giving them numeric ratings based on looks.

11.title: Detention-A-Rooney
11.plot: In order to get out of a mother/son pageant, Parker intentionally gets up to mischief to get detention. Meanwhile, Pete plays nurse when Liv and Maddie get sick at the same time.

12.title: Muffler-A-Rooney
12.plot: Liv is filming the "sequel" to the muffler commercial she did when she was six. Meanwhile, Maddie is feeling nervous about her knee as she prepares for her first game back.

13.title: Gift-A-Rooney
13.plot: Liv meddles with Diggie's "meet-a-versary" gift for Maddie and Parker concocts a new face cream for Karen.

14.title: Neighbors-A-Rooney
14.plot: During a neighborly feud with the Dippledorfs, Liv rekindles an old friendship with Holden Dippledorf. Meanwhile, Joey becomes fascinated with a new member he meets at his weekly Intergalactic Council meeting.

15.title: Repeat-A-Rooney
15.plot: Liv must finish a 6th-grade project to avoid taking summer school. Joey gets Maddie to teach him how to be a jock to impress a girl.

16.title: Cook-A-Rooney
16.plot: To raise her grade in Mr. Clodfelter's home economics class, Maddie must win the Plate Off and defeat the class master chef, Artie. Meanwhile, Joey convinces Pete to sponsor his made-up clubs at school.

17.title: Prom-A-Rooney
17.plot: Liv realizes she has a crush on Holden, but Andie asks him to prom before Liv can. With Diggie away, Karen arranges for Rooney cousin Craig to take Maddie to prom but when he arrives they realize that he has reinvented himself into an illusionist named Kraghh the Insidious.

18.title: Flugelball-A-Rooney
18.plot: Diggie comes back and Joey tries to reconnect, but Diggie gets the opportunity to go to Australia, and Maddie is afraid about another long-distance relationship. Meanwhile, Parker tries to teach his new friend how to ride a bike.

19.title: Band-A-Rooney
19.plot: Liv rallies together a band, The Dream, to compete in the upcoming Stevens Point Battle of the Bands contest. Joey and Artie form a band too, but they can't seem to agree on anything.

20.title: Video-A-Rooney
20.plot: Liv and her band mates are stumped and can't agree on a theme for their new music video. They enlist Parker to shoot the video with his new camera and Diggie enthusiastically signs on to join his crew.

21.title: Triangle-A-Rooney
21.plot: Liv and Holden share a special moment as they rehearse for an upcoming performance. Meanwhile, Reggie ditches Parker for a chance to play basketball with Maddie.

22.title: Frame-A-Rooney
22.plot: Ridgewood's mascot has been vandalized, and the Rooneys all become suspects. Meanwhile, Parker has the day off from school and gets into trouble at home with Reggie.

23.title: SPARF-A-Rooney
23.plot: Maddie and Diggie try to "out-fun" each other at a local music festival as Liv tries to help Andie get over her breakup.

24.title: Champ-A-Rooney
24.plot: Before Diggie leaves for Australia, he needs to find Maddie and tell her how he feels. Meanwhile, Parker, Reggie and Evan vow to stay on the couch until the new season of "Linda and Heather."

1.title: Continued-A-Rooney
1.plot: While Joey and Maddie try to catch Diggie before he departs for Australia, Liv covers for Maddie at home. But when Diggie shows up at the Rooney house, chaos ensues, reminding Parker of his favorite soap opera drama. Meanwhile, Liv gets a call from her manager telling her she landed a coveted role in a new TV show "Voltage."

2.title: Voltage-A-Rooney
2.plot: Maddie enlists Liv's help to build a giant Paulie Porcupine head for the Homecoming parade, but Joey and Parker accidentally destroy it while playing around with a stunt-prop from Liv's TV show, "Voltage."

3.title: Co-Star-A-Rooney
3.plot: Casting is underway for Liv's co-star in "Voltage" and some familiar faces show up for the auditions. Meanwhile, Karen arranges a "cleansing ceremony" for Maddie to help her let go of her feelings for Diggie.

4.title: Haunt-A-Rooney
4.plot: Maddie and Willow get ready for a Ridgewood tradition where high school seniors scare middle schoolers, while Liv has a run-in with a photographer when she attends the Central Park Spooktacular with Joey.

5.title: Cowbell-A-Rooney
5.plot: Liv tries to help her new co-star Josh feel more comfortable in Stevens Point while the rest of the school prepares for Cowbell Week, a Stevens Point tradition.

6.title: Grandma-A-Rooney
6.plot: Grandma Janice, visits the Rooney family to present her granddaughter Liv with the "Porcupine of the Year Award." But, Maddie grows suspicious that it's Janice's twin, Great-Aunt Hillary who's actually visiting and pulling a switcher.

7.title: Meatball-A-Rooney
7.plot: When Willow earns a scholarship that Maddie really wanted, the besties get into a huge fight. Then, when Joey accidentally breaks Liv's toe and tries to make things better, he ends up making it even worse.

8.title: Ask Her More-A-Rooney
8.plot: Liv gets upset when an interview focuses on her appearance instead of her acting. She enlists her friend Kristen Bell to help her change the conversation. Meanwhile, Maddie must hunt down a lost library book or else she won't get her final grades.

9.title: Joy To-A-Rooney
9.plot: Liv invites her "Voltage" director and crew over for the Rooney's traditional Christmas Eve dinner but is forced to enlist Artie's help to prepare the famed meal. Meanwhile, Maddie and Willow's gift exchange takes a surprising turn.

10.title: Ridgewood-A-Rooney
10.plot: When Parker gets bumped up a few grades, he starts attending high school with Liv, Maddie and Joey. The older siblings now have to deal with him being good at everything.

11.title: Coach-A-Rooney
11.plot: A new coach arrives to take charge of the girls' basketball team and immediately butts heads with Maddie. Meanwhile, when Liv agrees to help Parker with his art project, her date with Holden takes an unexpected turn.

12.title: Secret-Admirer-A-Rooney
12.plot: Joey and Parker hold strong beliefs that the Voltage set is haunted; Josh finds an excuse to spend time with Maddie.

13.title: Vive-La-Rooney
13.plot: When Liv needs to learn French for an upcoming interview, her mom decides to immerse her in the language and culture. Meanwhile, Maddie is thinking about dating again.

14.title: Dream-A-Rooney
14.plot: "Voltage" is taking up all of Liv's time, but when The Dream is asked to reunite for a fundraiser, Liv is determined to make it happen. Meanwhile, Maddie tries to figure out where to go to college.

15.title: Homerun-A-Rooney
15.plot: Maddie and Josh go on their first date. Liv and Holden try to help Parker pass his show choir class.

16.title: Scoop-A-Rooney
16.plot: A reporter mistakes Maddie for Liv while she's on a date with Josh. Maddie doesn't want Diggie to hear the news from the press, so she asks Liv to play along.

17.title: Choose-A-Rooney
17.plot: Diggie comes back to town to win Maddie after he saw the photo. Now Maddie needs to choose, Diggie or Josh? Who will she decide?

18.title: Friend-A-Rooney
18.plot: Liv is not too happy when Joey lands a part on her show, Voltage. Meanwhile, when Karen finds out that Andie's dad, Mr. Bustamante, disapproves of Dump Truck, they team up to change his mind.

19.title: Skyvolt-A-Rooney
19.plot: Liv finds out that Voltage plans to leave Stevens Point for Los Angeles and must decide to move with the show or stay in Wisconsin with Maddie.

20.title: Californi-A-Rooney
20.plot: While trying to decide if they're going to stick together or go their separate ways, Liv and Maddie have a big disagreement.

locations: Hollywood Center Studios - 1040 N. Las Palmas Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA
imdb.plot outline: Identical twins Liv, a popular television star whose hit show has just finished its run, and Maddie, an outstanding student and school basketball phenomenon whose popularity is on the rise, that is until Liv makes a triumphant return to their Wisconsin high school and complicating their teenage life even more is that their parents both work at their school.
imdb.title: Liv and Maddie
plot: Follows Liv, a popular television star whose show has just finished its run, and Maddie, an outstanding student and school basketball star whose popularity is on the rise, until Liv makes a return to their high school.::Anonymous

Identical twins Liv, a popular television star whose hit show has just finished its run, and Maddie, an outstanding student and school basketball phenomenon whose popularity is on the rise, that is until Liv makes a triumphant return to their Wisconsin high school and complicating their teenage life even more is that their parents both work at their school.::Anon

Centers on identical twins Liv & Maddie. One, a popular television star whose hit show has just finished its run, and Maddie, an outstanding student and school basketball phenomenon whose popularity is on the rise until Liv makes a triumphant return to their Wisconsin high school. Complicating their lives even more is that their parents both work at the school.::Disney

_Liv and Maddie_ (qv) are identical twins and built-in best friends. They live together when Liv came back from Hollywood. Although they are identical twins, their hobbies, lies and dislikes are different. Let's watch how will they solve their problems between them, their family and friends and we will see how much do _Liv and Maddie_ (qv) each other.

Liv, a popular actress returns back home after finishing her hit show "Sing It Loud". Maddie, a talented basketball player is her twin, their parents work in the highschool which they both attend. Together they go through rough teenage adventures together along with their brothers Joey and Parker.::Omar Hossam

Two identical twins Liv, a famous singer, actress, and performer who traveled to Hollywood for 4 years to follow her dreams, and Maddie, an athletic and popular basketball player are ready to go on adventures together when Liv comes home and complicates and makes their life even more complex where even though they break down, they have each other's back! When watching _Liv and Maddie_ (qv) we will follow these two sisters through the challenges they face together and how they work through it all as twins.
